image.altText: a dirty kitchen grate

props.synopsis: An outback service station in the Kimberley is forced to make changes to its health and safety practices after two former employees accuse it of operating in "disgusting" conditions.

title.children: Former staff accuse WA petrol station of serious hygiene breaches

image.altText: Three women sit under a shady tree on a limestone wall. From left to right wearing a dress, collard shirt, tshirt with hat.

props.synopsis: Jessie Carrie could not find the support she needed after being diagnosed with ADHD as an adult, so she started groups to help others.

title.children: Support groups helping connect women diagnosed with ADHD later in life

image.altText: Four ambulances parked at a hospital.

props.synopsis: A paramedic has been sentenced for stealing vials of an opioid used for pain relief, refilling them with saline and returning them into circulation in WA ambulances.

title.children: Ambulance station manager steals fentanyl, refills vials with saline

image.altText: A dolphin in the ocean with a brown sea sponge on it.

props.synopsis: Scientists have observed male humpback dolphins parading sea sponges on their heads in an unusual tactic to impress females and attract a mate off Western Australia's northern coast.

title.children: Male dolphins spotted donning sea-sponge wigs to attract females

image.altText: Unidentifiable students sitting at desks listen to a teacher in a primary school classroom.

props.synopsis: Not enough is being done to prevent children being denied enrolment at WA schools because of their disability, advocates say.

title.children: Calls for stronger laws to stop schools rejecting students with disabilities

image.altText: Phil Gore smiles above a caption which reads "PHIL GORE WINNER - 114 LAPS"

props.synopsis: Ultra-athlete Phil Gore is Australia's newest world champion after five days of near-continuous running in Bell Buckle, Tennessee.

title.children: West Aussie Gore told 'you stink' by wife after Backyard Ultra world title

image.altText: 4WD behind a police vehicle with flashing light.

props.synopsis: A video of an erratically driven vehicle chasing a police car in Kununurra on Wednesday has been posted on social media.

title.children: Pursuit aborted after juveniles allegedly chase police in stolen cars

image.altText: A school bus on fire on the side of a country road.

props.synopsis: Firefighters race to extinguish a school bus that burst into flames before this morning's school run in WA's South West, with the driver unharmed and no children on board.

title.children: Driver has lucky escape as school bus bursts into flames

image.altText: A river sits in a valley surrounded by mountains

props.synopsis: Traditional owners have raised cultural and environmental concerns about a proposed fluorite mine in Western Australia's remote Kimberley region.

title.children: Australia's first fluorite mine faces 'deep opposition' from traditional owners

image.altText: A small, brown , furry northern quoll up close.

props.synopsis: Rat bait poison has been found in threatened northern quoll populations as an overdue report into their use by the federal pesticides regulator is again delayed.

title.children: Threatened native animals at risk as rat bait review delayed again

image.altText: A black and white image of viper biting into a gel cylinder, a tiled background.

props.synopsis: Dozens of species of snakes have been captured on high-speed cameras, with researchers finding vipers were the fastest, but an Australian snake was not far behind.

title.children: Snakes can strike faster than your brain tells your muscles to move

image.altText: Australian currency

props.synopsis: From phishing to investment cons, scammers are staying "one step ahead" in their efforts to separate us from our savings. Older Australians are often targeted, but there are steps you can take to protect yourself, and those you care about.

title.children: Elizabeth clicked on an email link and lost her life savings

image.altText: A low angle shot of a black bike seat with a woman standing behind, back to the camera.

props.synopsis: "Saddle soreness" is a common complaint among cyclists. These innovators are looking at creative ways to prevent it by redesigning the bike seat.

title.children: Could a new bike seat prevent saddle pain? These innovators think so

image.altText: Men in white coats looking at beef carcasses inside an abattoir.

props.synopsis: A cattle company in Western Australia's Kimberley has struck a deal with a Northern Territory abattoir to get local beef to consumers in remote communities.

title.children: Indigenous cattle company supplying affordable beef to remote areas

image.altText: Minister for Environment Murray Watt speaking.

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Murray Watt links the passage of Labor's Environmental Protection Reform Bill to critical minerals, housing and renewable energy projects.

title.children: Minister says critical minerals, housing will suffer if environment laws aren't passed

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Greens open to negotiating with Labor on environmental protection reforms
Murray Watt says government is open to amendments on environment bill
Kevin Rudd did a 'good job' on critical minerals deal: Jane Hume

image.altText: A man folds his hands in front of him seated at a riverside picnic table.

props.synopsis: Locals in the WA community of Waroona are welcoming a US-Australia deal set to build a new rare earth refinery south of Perth, but others warn the project will further entrench mining interests.

title.children: WA town split on US-backed gallium refinery to be built nearby

image.altText: A graphic with an ambulance in the background, a phone with 000 on it and the logo of Telstra, Optus and Vodafone.

props.synopsis: A Vodafone customer who was repeatedly unable to ring triple-0 says the major telco failed to help her fix the problem for months.

title.children: Vodafone gave mixed messaging over service issues with triple-0, customer says

image.altText: Harrie Lavreysen holds up the hand of Leigh Hoffman

props.synopsis: Australia's team pursuit squad and keirin rider Leigh Hoffman have both claimed silver medals on day two of the UCI track world championships in Santiago, Chile.

title.children: Hoffman steps up with sensational keirin silver

image.altText: A hand holds a mobile phone with the screen showing several social media apps

props.synopsis: Police did not know his name but they did have his Snapchat handle. From there, detectives pieced together a case that would reveal the true identity of sex offender 'Alec'.

title.children: The digital breadcrumb that led police to 'Alec', a child sex offender

image.altText: A submarine at the surface with morning sun on its right flank, the ocean stretches behind it

props.synopsis: In Washington on Monday, Anthony Albanese made something clear once again: Australia is all-in on the trilateral defence pact. Clarifying what US powerbrokers think remains a multi-billion-dollar question.

title.children: Australia is all in on AUKUS. In Donald Trump's America, it's more complicated

image.altText: A black object on a dusty red dirt road.

props.synopsis: How closely were you following the news this week? Test yourself to find out!

title.children: News quiz: A jewel heist, an awkward Trump moment and an outback mystery

image.altText: .A young woman with fair skin and brown hair

props.synopsis: Despite one in four sufferers being under 65, experts say there is a common misconception that strokes only occur in older people. Mental well-being is key to recovery but is often more difficult for younger stroke survivors.

title.children: Elena was a fit and healthy 20-year-old — then she had a stroke

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is around the flatline on Friday following gains on Wall Street, but may still manage a weekly gain. Investor sentiment has been buoyed by news that Donald Trump plans to meet with Xi Jinping, while US sanctions on Russia have pushed oil prices higher. Follow live.

title.children: ASX on track for weekly gain as critical minerals, energy stocks rise

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Consumer watchdog vows to support Australians' access to cash
Transporting cash remains an issue: RBA Governor

image.altText: Silver and gold bars

props.synopsis: Precious metal prices have been pushing record highs and, as queues lengthened outside bullion traders, gold and silver prices suddenly fell back. But positive signs remain, analysts say.

title.children: A silver lining for investors rushing into precious metals

image.altText: A man wearing a light pink jumper and glasses holds an old book wile sitting in a store surrounded by books.

props.synopsis: There are many factors that can determine the monetary value of a book, so what can make an edition worth tens of thousands of dollars?

title.children: What makes a book valuable? Hint — it's not only first editions that are sought after

image.altText: A bearded goalkeeper poised to make a save during a soccer game in front of a large crowd.

props.synopsis: Socceroos hero Andrew Redmayne sheds light on the stresses A-League players face after a report finds footballers are struggling with their mental health, substance abuse and job security issues.

title.children: 'Hell of a lot of stress': A-League mental health concerns revealed

image.altText: Sam Neill and three actors in front of the Dish

props.synopsis: The film The Dish helped reintroduce a new generation of Australians to the critical role the Parkes Observatory played in the Moon landing. Twenty-five years after its release, the film has had a lasting impact.

title.children: How The Dish reintroduced Australia to the Moon landing

image.altText: Various images of two men partipacting in a local parkrun in Karratha, WA.

props.synopsis: Shaded and green spaces can be hard to find in northern towns and cities where summer temperatures regularly surpass 40 degrees Celsius.

title.children: Climate adaptation 'shortfall' exposes vulnerability to hotter temperatures

image.altText: A young female Paralympian holding flower while celebrating winning a silver medal

props.synopsis: Sydney 2000 was a turning point — not just for me, but for the entire Paralympic movement, writes silver medallist Elizabeth Wright.

title.children: Winning a silver medal at the Sydney Paralympics changed everything

image.altText: WA Treasurer Rita Saffioti stands touching a soccer ball.

props.synopsis: The state government is doubling down on its plan to bring European football heavyweights AC Milan to Perth to play a historic Italian league game, despite significant backlash from fans and players.

title.children: AC Milan game will go ahead despite controversy, deputy premier says

image.altText: Oakford crash scene

props.synopsis: Six people are taken to hospital, including a baby and a critically injured man, after three cars collide in the southern Perth suburb of Oakford.

title.children: Six people injured in Perth crash including baby and child

image.altText: a plane flies in the sky

props.synopsis: Creditors owed millions of dollars — including regional councils in Western Australia — remain in the dark, despite a new owner being found for the embattled Rex Airlines.

title.children: Sale of Rex to US company leaves WA councils in doubt over debt

image.altText: Police launched a manhunt for the three individuals.

props.synopsis: Three men forced to cling to an esky to survive in wild seas off Albany as they tried to import hundreds of kilograms of cocaine into WA are described by a judge as “Keystone criminals” at their sentencing.

title.children: Bungling drug smugglers found clinging to esky in wild seas jailed
